oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grady Martin interviewed by Jay Oermann Side One
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Grady Martin being interviewed by Jay Oermann. The recording's date is currently unidentified.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Grady Martin
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:00) -- Interview begins with Grady Martin mentioning "Black Mountain Rag." (0:13) -- Jay Oermann asks Grady Martin about early recording. Jay Oermann quickly responds that there wasn't a recording scene in 1941. Grady Martin then mentions his group (Big Jeff Bess & The Radio Playboys) often played an early morning radio show and local schoolhouses. (1:07) -- Discussion about "Jabbo" Arrington. Jabbo played guitar with a thumb pick. (2:09) -- Grady Martin discusses working with the Bailes Brothers. (3:02) -- Grady Martin mentions touring with Jamup & Honey for a year. (3:24) -- Grady Martin discusses working with The Duke Of Paducah. (4:00) -- Interviewer asks Grady Martin about who he copied guitar licks from in the 1930's and 1940's. Grady mentions Django Reinhardt. (4:55) -- Interviewer asks Grady Martin about "Chattanoogie Shoe Shine Boy." (5:34) -- Grady Martin speaks about his twin guitar work with "Jabbo" Arrington.
